concepts.name: Statistics
concepts.definition: Methods for analyzing data and drawing conclusions from numerical information

concepts.name: Mean
concepts.definition: The arithmetic average of a set of numbers - sum of all values divided by number of values

concepts.name: Median
concepts.definition: The middle value in a set of numbers when arranged in numerical order

concepts.name: Mode
concepts.definition: The value that appears most frequently in a data set

concepts.name: Precision
concepts.definition: Refers to the consistency and repeatability of measurements - indicates how close repeated measurements are to each other

concepts.name: Accuracy
concepts.definition: Refers to how close a measurement is to the true or accepted value - indicates the correctness of a measurement

concepts.name: Ratio
concepts.definition: A comparison of two quantities by division - shows relative size of two quantities

concepts.name: Proportion
concepts.definition: An equation that states that two ratios are equal - expresses equivalence of two ratios

concepts.name: Probability
concepts.definition: The study of chance and uncertainty - measures likelihood that event will occur (0=impossible to 1=certain)
concepts.example: Probability of heads in coin flip: 0.5

concepts.name: Equation
concepts.definition: A mathematical statement showing equality of two expressions with equals sign

concepts.name: Average
concepts.definition: A single value representing central tendency of a set of values - summarizes typical value in data set

concepts.name: Angle
concepts.definition: Geometric figure formed by two rays sharing common endpoint (vertex) - measured in degrees/radians

concepts.name: Quadrilateral
concepts.definition: Polygon with four sides and four angles - sum of interior angles is 360 degrees
